title: Global Economy - South China Morning Post
description: Global economy news, including budgets, stock markets and analysis.

items.title: Secure Arctic shipping route essential for China, senior official says
items.creator: Carol Yang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Secure Arctic shipping route essential for China, senior official says
items.content:
The Arctic shipping route is essential to safeguard China’s development over the next decade, a senior Chinese official said in Beijing, calling for greater efforts to expand its practical use.
With proposals for the next five-year plan incorporating security and development, China must ensure its international transport channels remain unimpeded, Ma Jiantang, deputy director of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference’s economic committee, said.
China’s traditional trade lanes...

items.title: China cuts US Treasury holdings to lowest level since 2008 amid debt ceiling fears
items.creator: Sylvia Ma
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China cuts US Treasury holdings to lowest level since 2008 amid debt ceiling fears
items.content:
China reduced its US Treasury holdings in October to its lowest level in 17 years, as mounting concerns over US debt sustainability and the Federal Reserve’s independence further eroded confidence in dollar-backed assets.
The country’s stockpile fell to US$688.7 billion in October, down from US$700.5 billion in September, according to US Treasury Department data released on Thursday.
October’s figure was the lowest level reported since November 2008, and marked a plunge of more than 47 per cent...

items.title: China confirms issuing of first general licences for rare earth exports
items.creator: Ji Siqi,Kandy Wong
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China confirms issuing of first general licences for rare earth exports
items.content:
Beijing confirmed on Thursday that it has begun granting general licences with lengthier terms for exports of rare earth elements to foreign companies, though business groups said more guidance was needed on the policy’s implementation.
“With the accumulation of relevant export compliance experience, some exporters have initially met the basic requirements to apply for general licences,” said He Yadong, a spokesman for the Ministry of Commerce (Mofcom), at a press conference.
“To my knowledge,...

items.title: China slams EU subsidy probes as ‘egregious’ and discriminatory
items.creator: Xiaofei Xu,Ji Siqi
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China slams EU subsidy probes as ‘egregious’ and discriminatory
items.content:
China’s Ministry of Commerce has expressed strong opposition to recent European Union investigations into Chinese companies and vowed to use necessary means to defend their rights.
“The European Union has recently launched a series of Foreign Subsidies Regulation (FSR) investigations targeting Chinese enterprises … such actions are egregious, with clear targeting and discriminatory intent,” ministry spokesman He Yadong said during a press conference on Thursday.
Last week, Brussels launched an...

items.title: China’s Hainan launches separate customs regime allowing tariff-free imports
items.creator: Mia Nurmamat
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s Hainan launches separate customs regime allowing tariff-free imports
items.content:
China’s southern Hainan province implemented a separate customs regime on Thursday, as Beijing seeks to develop the island into an offshore financing and duty-free hub and position it as a strategic hedge against rising external trade barriers.
The new customs regime creates two distinct customs boundaries for Hainan: one separating the island from overseas markets, and another dividing it from the rest of mainland China.
Most overseas goods entering the island – which is roughly the size of...

items.title: As trade deficit mounts, is EU offering China what it wants to buy?
items.creator: Xiaofei Xu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: As trade deficit mounts, is EU offering China what it wants to buy?
items.content:
Facing an ever-increasing trade deficit with China, Europe has limited options to balance the situation in the short term even though it still holds an edge in key sectors including pharmaceuticals, machinery and components, analysts said.
China’s global trade surplus hit an all-time high of US$1.076 trillion in the first 11 months of this year, despite a decline in exports to the United States following US President Donald Trump’s imposition of steep tariffs.
A lot of China’s redirected exports...

items.title: Laos cleared to export fresh durians to China as Malaysia, Thailand face new rival
items.creator: Ralph Jennings
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Laos cleared to export fresh durians to China as Malaysia, Thailand face new rival
items.content:
Laos has received approval to begin exporting fresh durians to China, becoming the latest Southeast Asian nation to vie for a slice of the vast Chinese market for the tropical fruit.
China’s General Administration of Customs said on its website that Laos was given clearance to begin exports from this past Friday as long as its shipments met phytosanitary standards.
Laos could emerge as a challenger in China’s increasingly crowded durian market, as it benefits from cheap labour, logistical...

items.title: Wealthy Chinese appear to shun Trump’s ‘gold card’ immigration programme
items.creator: He Huifeng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Wealthy Chinese appear to shun Trump’s ‘gold card’ immigration programme
items.content:
When US President Donald Trump first proposed his “gold card” programme earlier this year, offering permanent residency to the super-rich, Beijing-based emigration consultant Jack Jing received unsolicited inquiries from seven high-net-worth families.
But that initial enthusiasm quickly waned after the application details were released last week. None of his clients plan to apply in the near term, said Jing, general manager of the migration service provider WellTrend, who has decades of...

items.title: What does future hold for Brazil, US in China’s soybean balancing act?
items.creator: Mandy Zuo
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: What does future hold for Brazil, US in China’s soybean balancing act?
items.content:
China, the world’s top soybean consumer, faces a complex balancing act when securing supplies.
With 90 per cent of market demand met by imports, Brazil and the United States remain its top suppliers, but intensifying efforts to promote self-sufficiency are seeking to reduce reliance on imports.
From price swings and quality traits to strategic roles in the market, soybeans from the three countries tell different stories about China’s quest for stability and security that can be broken down into...

items.title: China bets big on copper, but ‘weaponisation’ risks low, unlike with rare earths: analysts
items.creator: Kandy Wong
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China bets big on copper, but ‘weaponisation’ risks low, unlike with rare earths: analysts
items.content:
China is accelerating efforts to secure its copper supply chain, designating the metal as critical across strategic industries such as electric vehicles, artificial intelligence and defence amid rising geopolitical tensions.
Provincial governments are leading the charge. On Monday, Jiangxi – already a hub for heavy rare earth mines – pledged in its 15th five-year plan to develop a world-leading hub for advanced copper-based new materials.
That follows a similar move in Shandong, where provincial...

items.title: Policy body urges China to confront economic challenges, confident of demand recovery
items.creator: Sylvia Ma
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Policy body urges China to confront economic challenges, confident of demand recovery
items.content:
China’s top economic policy coordinator has urged the country to confront unavoidable challenges, while expressing confidence that investment and consumption growth will recover next year as efforts to boost domestic demand intensify.
An unnamed official from the Office of the Central Financial and Economic Affairs Commission said the current challenges were “issues arising in the course of development and transition”.
“[They] cannot be avoided or sidestepped, but with effort they can be...

items.title: Why South Korea is becoming China’s new bargain travel hotspot amid Japan spat
items.creator: Yeon Woo Lee,Ralph Jennings
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Why South Korea is becoming China’s new bargain travel hotspot amid Japan spat
items.content:
As Chinese tourists pull back from visiting Japan amid a diplomatic row, a slumping won is positioning South Korea as the new bargain destination for mainland travellers, analysts said.
The Korean won has become Asia’s worst-performing currency in the second half of the year, weighed down by an interest rate gap with the United States and sustained equity outflows to the US market.
In October, South Korea’s real effective exchange rate plunged to a 16-year low – falling even further than it did...

items.title: China slaps anti-dumping duties on EU pork, but lowers final rates
items.creator: Ji Siqi,Xiaofei Xu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China slaps anti-dumping duties on EU pork, but lowers final rates
items.content:
China has announced anti-dumping taxes of up to 19.8 per cent on pork imports from the European Union, following an 18-month investigation.
Effective on Wednesday, the duties – ranging from 4.9 per cent to 19.8 per cent, depending on the company – will be implemented for a period of five years, according to a notice issued by the Ministry of Commerce on Tuesday.
The rates in the final ruling are significantly lower than those included in a preliminary determination in September, when EU pork...

items.title: China offers more support to returning overseas students as influx grows
items.creator: Xinyi Wu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China offers more support to returning overseas students as influx grows
items.content:
China has launched a national-level service platform to help returning overseas students find work and start businesses, as the country steps up its efforts to attract talent and the number of returnees surges.
The Ministry of Education has partnered with 50 organisations to provide returnees with entrepreneurial mentors and match them directly with local government and corporate needs.
The measures show the value of overseas returnees is still recognised at the national level, despite recent...

items.title: India’s property market enters the big league but challenges remain
items.creator: Nicholas Spiro
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: India’s property market enters the big league but challenges remain
items.content:
Numbers do not always tell the whole story. But they are revealing nonetheless. In 2013, direct investment transaction volumes in India’s commercial property sector stood at around US$1.3 billion. By contrast, in China (excluding Hong Kong), investment activity reached US$27 billion. In South Korea, transactions stood at US$12.2 billion, data from MSCI shows.
The woefully low level of investment in India – a leading emerging market that at the time was already the world’s third-largest economy...

items.title: Xpeng steps up ‘go global’ drive with Malaysian EV assembly hub for Southeast Asian market

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Xpeng steps up ‘go global’ drive with Malaysian EV assembly hub for Southeast Asian market

images.alt: The Xpeng factory in Zhaoqing, Guangdong province, November 19, 2020. Photo: SCMP
images.title: The Xpeng factory in Zhaoqing, Guangdong province, November 19, 2020. Photo: SCMP

items.content:
Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker Xpeng plans to establish a production base in Malaysia targeting Southeast Asian customers, in its latest move to expand overseas to improve profitability.
The Guangzhou-based company, 5 per cent owned by Volkswagen Group, said on Monday that it would partner with Malaysian firm EP Manufacturing Berhad (EPMB), an investment conglomerate focusing on automotive manufacturing and engineering, to locally assemble its intelligent electric cars tailored to the needs...

items.title: China’s growing young billionaire class masks innovation hurdles, analysts say
items.creator: Mandy Zuo
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s growing young billionaire class masks innovation hurdles, analysts say
items.content:
While China continues to produce many young self-made billionaires, showcasing its economic dynamism, observers have urged the creation of a more supportive environment, saying that innovation is still being held back.
About 98 per cent of the super-rich in mainland China, with assets valued at US$1 billion or more, are relatively young first-generation entrepreneurs, reflecting the vitality and wealth-creation power of its economy, Swiss bank UBS said in a recent report.
However, Beijing’s...

items.title: China’s EV battery giants wade into shipbuilding to bolster Beijing’s dominance
items.creator: Daniel Ren
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s EV battery giants wade into shipbuilding to bolster Beijing’s dominance

images.alt: People visit a model of a nuclear-powered container ship at Marintec China 2025 in Shanghai on December 2, 2025. Photo: Getty Images
images.title: People visit a model of a nuclear-powered container ship at Marintec China 2025 in Shanghai on December 2, 2025. Photo: Getty Images

items.content:
China’s leading battery makers for electric cars – Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL) and Gotion High-tech – are adding momentum to the country’s efforts to build new-energy vessels, with their latest products supplied to large ocean carriers amid an accelerated decarbonisation drive.
Chinese-made pure electric-powered container vessels were also set to extend Beijing’s lead over global rivals in shipbuilding, according to industry officials and analysts.
CATL, the world’s largest electric...

items.title: China’s airlines in the hot seat over hidden extra fees as watchdog steps in
items.creator: Frank Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s airlines in the hot seat over hidden extra fees as watchdog steps in
items.content:
China’s airlines are encountering severe turbulence over their growing use of extra charges like seat selection fees, as passengers, state media and a consumer protection watchdog slam the practice as a violation of customers’ rights.
The controversy reflects the difficulties Chinese airlines face as they try to strike a delicate balance between profitability and service quality, with an industry insider cautioning that companies may not be able to scrap extra fees completely.
Seat selection...

items.title: From climate change to health, global problems need investors to step up
items.creator: Anthony Rowley
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: From climate change to health, global problems need investors to step up
items.content:
People love to hate governments, and they loathe having to pay taxes. However, from now on, we’ll have to embrace more state intervention and the need for higher taxes or else legislate a more dirigiste system of directing personal savings into investment that isn’t so dependent on markets.
This can be either done preemptively or in response to the next financial crisis. It goes without saying that the former course of action is surely preferable to the trauma that will be experienced in the...
